meanings.definition: The action of demanding and obtaining something from someone, especially money or services.
meanings.sent1: The exactions of the landlord left the tenant struggling to pay rent.
meanings.sent2: The government imposed exactions on the citizens to fund public projects.
meanings.sent3: The exactions for using the company printer were so high, it felt like a printer robbery!
meanings.sent4: Her exactions for attention were like a toll booth on the highway of friendship.
meanings.sent5: The exactions of the bully made school feel like a never-ending tax season.

meanings.sent1: The exactions of the teacher for extra homework seemed excessive to the students.
meanings.sent2: The exactions of the boss made it hard for employees to have work-life balance.
meanings.sent3: The exactions for wearing a tie to the party were so strict, it felt like a fashion dictatorship!
meanings.sent4: His exactions for perfection in the project were like trying to catch a falling star.
meanings.sent5: The exactions of the coach made training feel like climbing a mountain without gear.
